Label: False
Top1: 'Ultimate Frisbee' recognised by International Olympic Committee
Top2: Israel approves use of harsher measures against 'Jewish terrorists'
Top3: 2000 year old termite mounds in Africa confirm that insects can sustain a millennia in the same home
Top4: Photojournalist found dead in Mexico City after he fled harassment in his home state Veracruz, where 11 journalists have been killed there since 2010
Top5: Japanese Heat Wave Kills Six, Leaves Over 3,000 Hospitalized - A heat wave in Japan caused the deaths of six people over the weekend, almost 40 Japanese nationals were killed by heatstroke since June.
Top6: Colombia aims to buy land from private owners and redistribute it among the poor after its 50-year-old war ends, the government said Sunday, addressing the root cause of the conflict.The conflict has left more than 200,000 dead and forced some six million people from their homes.
Top7: Canadian PM Stephen Harper dissolves Parliament, calls general election for October 19
Top8: Nigeria's military has rescued 71 girls and women in firefights that killed several Boko Haram fighters
Top9: Former City trader Tom Hayes has been found guilty at a London court of rigging global Libor interest rates.
Top10: Ex-British prime minister named in child sex abuse investigation
Top11: Drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline , which was fined a record 3 billion yuan ($483 million) for corruption in China last year and is examining possible staff misconduct elsewhere, faces new allegations of bribery in Romania.
Top12: Indonesian foundation defends awarding Kim Jong-un peace prize
Top13: Illegal immigrants to UK face eviction without court order under new plans - Landlords who fail to check tenants immigration status face five-year jail terms as part of government crackdown to reduce UKs appeal as a migrant destination
Top14: Landlords who fail to evict migrants who do not have the right to live in Britain could be jailed for up to five years under measures to be included in the Immigration Bill.
Top15: Japan calls US spying allegations 'deeply regrettable'
Top16: Saudi king cuts short controversial holiday in France - BBC News
Top17: Al-Qaeda Militants Accuse Islamic State Of Being A Con
Top18: Healthy British nurse ends her life in a Swiss clinic because of fear of getting old
Top19: Dutch crane collapse demolishes houses, injuring at least 20.

Top25: Two alleged 'IS' returnees to Germany go on trial

Label: False
Top1: Iraq is rushing to digitize its national library under the threat of ISIS
Top2: Zimbabwe bans lion hunting after international outcry
Top3: Delta bans shipment of lion, leopard, elephant, rhino, buffalo trophies
Top4: Saudi ministry: 'Free expression is an abuse of religious rights'
Top5: New Study from Finland: People would be happier living near a drug rehab center than living near a mosque.
Top6: After having praised the friendliness of the sport, the president of a bullfighting club was gored by a bull after it jumped out of the ring and attacked him viciously.
Top7: 8 Eight suitcases full of ivory seized at Zurich airport - Elephant tusks with estimated black-market value of about 265,000 were being transported from Tanzania to China via Switzerland. The tusks had been sawed into pieces to fit into the luggage.
Top8: Russia makes a new claim for the Northpole
Top9: Stop burning fossil fuels now: there is no CO2 'technofix', scientists warn - Researchers have demonstrated that even if a geoengineering solution to CO2 emissions could be found, it wouldnt be enough to save the oceans
Top10: Airbus patents jet to fly London-New York in 1 hour
Top11: Bitcoin deemed regular currency by Australian Senate Committee
Top12: It is worse than Hitler, worse than AIDS, cancer or any other epidemic. It is more catastrophic than nuclear holocaust, and it must be stopped. -Creator of the list of the banned Indian porn sites
Top13: Canada, a resource economy, is the only G7 country in a recession
Top14: United Joins Delta Banning Big-Game Trophies After Cecil Killing
Top15: Obama says no challenge greater threat to U.S. future than climate change
Top16: A massive gate unearthed in Israel may have marked the entrance to a biblical city that, at its heyday, was the biggest metropolis in the region.
Top17: G20 countries pay over $1,000 per citizen in fossil fuel subsidies, say IMF Worlds leading economies still paying trillions in subsidies despite pledges to phase them out, new figures show
Top18: China is demanding that the Obama administration return a wealthy and politically connected businessman who fled to the United States, according to several American officials familiar with the case. Should he seek political asylum, he could become one of the most damaging defectors
Top19: 7.5 year prison sentence sought for 18 Turkish journalists for reporting on alleged covert arms shipments by the Turkish government into Syria.
Top20: Isis 'price list' for child slaves confirmed as genuine by UN official Zainab Bangura
Top21: Women Killed Alongside Mexican Photojournalist Were Tortured & Raped - 3 of the 4 women with Ruben Espinosa were assaulted before being shot in the head after an all-night party among friends in a middle-class section of Mexico City
Top22: Russia calls for international cooperation to fight Islamic State
Top23: Speed of glacier retreat worldwide 'historically unprecedented', says report. Researchers have recorded rapid rises in meltwater and alarming rates of glacial retreat, which are accelerating at a pace double that of a decade ago.
Top24: Israeli president flooded with death threats for condemning 'Jewish terror'
Top25: More than 450 civilians killed in US-led airstrikes against the Islamic State

Top1: China says TPP should be transparent, open
Top2: Palestinians shield Israeli policewoman from rocks thrown by Jewish extremists
Top3: Approval for world's biggest coalmine overturned by Australian federal court
Top4: Frequent spicy meals linked to human longevity - Seven-year study of adults in China matches regular consumption of spicy foods, such as chilli peppers, to 14% reduced risk of death.
Top5: India nixes online porn ban following intense public outrage on social media
Top6: Saudi-led coalition invades Yemen with ground forces.
Top7: Claims of child sex abuse against ex-British PM Edward Heath
Top8: 'I came to kill Hindus, it's fun doing this,' says captured Pakistani terrorist Naved
Top9: The proportion of people [in Russia] who think religion does more good than harm to society has slumped from 61% to 36% while the share detecting more harm than good has risen from 5% to 23%.
Top10: ISIS horror: Girls get peddled like petrol barrels, says UN envoy
Top11: Snowden leaks confirm existence of ECHELON
Top12: Tony Blair could face trial for 'illegal' Iraq war, suggests Jeremy Corbyn Corbyn, the Labour leadership frontrunner, claims Chilcot report may lead to consequences for former PM over decisions made during 2003 invasion
Top13: While other airlines ban hunting trophy shipments, UPS says it wont bow to controversy
Top14: Islamic State sex slave price list authentic, $165 for a child - UN
Top15: ISIS has threatened to kill a Croatian hostage if Egypt does not meet its demands in 48 hours
Top16: Bonobos Apes Found To Communicate Verbally Much Like that of Human Babies
Top17: Israel jails Jewish extremist for 6 months without trial.
Top18: German justice minister demands sacking of chief prosecutor over treason investigation into two journalists.
Top19: Anti-corruption protests have gripped Honduras and Guatemala in recent weeks.Thousands have been taking to the streets weekly for three months now to demand an end to impunity, and there are no signs that the demonstrations will soon die down.
Top20: Israeli archaeologists say they are trying to decode ancient inscriptions written in Hebrew script discovered at a dig in Jerusalem. The writing was found on the walls of a room containing the remains of a Jewish ritual bath, or mikveh, believed to be about 2,000 years old.
Top21: Bomb scare at University of Oslo, Guard shot - Police cordoned off a large area of the campus Wednesday morning and called in specialists to examine an object feared to be a bomb. The major operation was unfolding after a security guard was shot in the same area during the night
Top22: Israel jails suspected Jewish militant without trial
Top23: Russia, Putin Held in Low Regard around the World: Outside its own borders, neither Russia nor its president, Vladimir Putin, receives much respect or support
Top24: Catholic bishop in "death to gays" storm -- Vitus Huonder, the controversial Catholic bishop of Chur in eastern Switzerland, has once again attracted criticism for quoting homophobic Bible passages including Leviticus 20:13, which calls for homosexuals to be executed
Top25: China appeals for U.S. help to fight "Islamic militants" in Xinjiang

Label: False
Top1: iTunes is illegal under UK copyright law - The Intellectual Property Office today explains that ripping a CD in iTunes is no longer permitted, and neither is backing up your computer if it contains copyrighted content.
Top2: Turkish couple feed 4,000 Syrian refugees on wedding day instead of wedding
Top3: TPP Copyright Chapter Leaks: Website Blocking, New Criminal Rules On the Way
Top4: Debris found from Reunion Island confirmed to be from MH370
Top5: Sea animals are dying off in massive numbers along the Pacific Coastline from Baja, Mexico all the way to Alaska.A combination of man-made and natural causes are killing off bottlenose dolphins, sardines, sea birds, plankton, krill, salmon, sea lions, starfish, and brown pelicans in record numbers.
Top6: Indian oncologists want cannabis legalised to help fight cancer
Top7: Canada Changed Its Election Rules So It Could Negotiate the TPP
Top8: Russia marks 1 year of sanctions by destroying Western food - despite 250,000 signatures on a petition to donate that food to the poor. The lower supply of food also serves to drive consumer prices up, pushing more citizens below the poverty line.
Top9: Rejecting Iran nuclear deal is a vote for war, Obama says
Top10: Pharmaceutical firms Pfizer and Flynn Pharma have been accused by the UK's competition watchdog of charging "excessive and unfair" prices for an anti-epilepsy drug.
Top11: China willing to work with US to contribute to world peace, stability.China is ready to step up cooperation with the United States in the fields of investment, military, climate change, finance, economy and trade, energy, hunt of corrupt officials, justice and public health.
Top12: Australian spy agency says a junior Defence staffer allegedly took home a secret intelligence report and posted it on 4Chan
Top13: Pope Francis says even after divorce, you can remain in the church
Top14: Norway feared terrorism in Oslo after security guard claimed he was shot and a suspected bomb was found at University of Oslo. Now the security guard admits that he was behind the shooting and the fake bomb himself.
Top15: Windfarm 'wing nuts': Public health expert takes aim at activists. "Infrasound generated by mere walking has been shown to be louder than the noise of wind turbines ... I assume your committee is not concerned about walking noise health impacts?"
Top16: Nasa says Congress cuts mean $490m is needed to buy rides on Russian rockets
Top17: More Dutch cities may join in 'basic income' experiment
Top18: You taught our students, so we are releasing you: Islamic State to Indians abducted in Libya
Top19: Survey suggests strong popular support for Jew-free Romania
Top20: British truck driver radios international space station from garden shed
Top21: Loss of world's rarest ape charted - Decline of the Hainan gibbon - worlds rarest primate - has been revealed by a trawl through historical Chinese documents. There are only 26-28 left in the wild. Old govt documents helping reveal when & how the numbers fell.
Top22: Scientists in Iran clone endangered mouflon  born to domestic sheep: Poaching has driven the Isfahan mouflon close to extinction in Iran, where scientists are hailing the rare successful example of interspecies cloning.
Top23: Hamas warns of new violence unless Israel lifts blockade
Top24: Newfoundland and Labrador eliminates student loans
Top25: MH370: Debris Of Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 'Was Faked' Claim Relatives Of Victims

Label: False
Top1: Brazilian radio host famous for exposing corruption in his city murdered while broadcasting live on the air by two gunmen.
Top2: John Kerry: Vietnam war was result of 'profound failure of diplomatic insight'.Im reminded of conversations Ive had recently with people who talk almost casually about the prospect of war with one country or another. Im tempted to say: You dont have the first idea of what youre talking about
Top3: Al Qaeda blow up 700 year old mosque in Yemen
Top4: Bangladesh blogger Niloy Neel hacked to death, 4th blogger to get killed in recent months.
Top5: North Korea to push back its standard time by 30 minutes, calls it 'Pyongyang time'
Top6: Man jailed for 30 years in Thailand for insulting the monarchy on Facebook.
Top7: Tens of thousands of Russians have joined a protest petition to President Vladimir Putin after vast quantities of foreign food are bulldozed, buried, or burned. For the past year, Russia has banned most fresh produce from countries imposing economic sanctions against Russia over Crimea.
Top8: Canada Proposes A Ban On Tiny Plastic Microbeads, Citing Environmental & Health Concerns
Top9: Archaeologists have discovered a mysterious Stonehenge-style monolith in the deep sea off the coast of Sicily, shedding new light on the earliest civilizations in the Mediterranean basin. Its features leave no doubt that the monolith was man-made some 10,000 years ago.
Top10: British VIP Pedophile Scandal: Nationwide police corruption inquiry is looking into alleged witness tampering to stop child abuse claims, including against a former Tory Prime Minister
Top11: Russia hacks Pentagon computers
Top12: An amateur radio enthusiast managed to get a quick chat with the International Space Station (ISS) after a month of trying to get through from his shed
Top13: Palestinian religious leaders  both Muslims and Christians  signed a declaration stating that Jews have no right to enter the Temple Mount at a press conference in east Jerusalem on Wednesday.
Top14: New Zealand Made Trolling Illegal Last Month - Law states that anyone who causes "harm by posting digital communication," a.k.a. trolling, is liable to conviction & could face up to 2 yrs in prison & be subject to $50,000 NZD ($32,570 USD) in fines.
Top15: Nuclear test refugees from Bikini atoll in the Marshall Islands are now fleeing the effects of climate change as their second home, Kili Island, is suffering from sea level rise. Appealing to the US for financial help with relocation.
Top16: Swiss find remains of 2 Japanese climbers missing since 1970
Top17: Yazidi Child Soldiers Take Revenge on ISIS
Top18: El Nio Conditions Are Growing Stronger
Top19: Russian whistleblower may have been victim of 'reprisal killing', court hears - Alexander Perepilichnyy was found dead outside his home in Surrey in 2012. In May it emerged he may have ingested a deadly plant poison.
Top20: Senior Russian Official praises the proposal of import restrictions on condoms, stating they "have nothing to do with health" and suggesting it would make people more "disciplined"
Top21: More than 240,000 people, including 12,000 children, have been killed in Syria's conflict which broke out in March 2011.
Top22: Sky News' Live Stream Shut Down By Fox News DMCA Notice - The official live stream of Sky News has been pulled from YouTube after a copyright complaint from competing news outlet Fox News.
Top23: Lord Janner told to attend court over child abuse charges
Top24: Its common knowledge that some frogs secrete toxins from special glands in their skin. But according to a paper published today in Current Biology, an international team of researchers report for the first time ever that two frog species are actually venomous.
Top25: South China Sea dispute: John Kerry says US will not accept restrictions on movements in the sea
